Reason: The 'key_cache_save_period' configuration is considered performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly impacts the frequency at which the key cache is saved, which can have a notable performance variation at the system level. The code snippet related to the configuration shows that the 'scheduleSaving' method schedules the saving of the key cache based on the configured save period in seconds. This operation is time-expensive and memory-expensive as it involves submitting writes and running tasks at fixed delays. Therefore, the configuration is performance-sensitive as it directly affects system performance by optimizing I/O usage and improving cold-start speeds.
